revised_title: Investigating Diurnal Changes in Intensity of Dipping and Horizontal Needles
tldr: The author conducted experiments to compare the diurnal changes in intensity of dipping and horizontal needles at Port Bowen. The results indicate that the changes in the horizontal needle's intensity are due to a daily variation in the amount of dip rather than a variation in the general intensity of the Earth's magnetic force. This supports the idea of a small variation in the position of the magnetic axis due to the Earth's rotation and the influence of the Sun on the magnetism of the Earth's parts.
